newsitem.title: USA: Mobil restarts Illinois hydrogen unit at weekend.
newsitem.headline: Mobil restarts Illinois hydrogen unit at weekend.

text.p: Mobil Corp restarted the downed hydrotreater at its Joliet, Illinois refinery over the weekend after a small fire shut the unit the previous weekend, a company spokeswoman said.

The outage of the 65,000 barrel per day (bpd) hydrogen desulphurization unit, which produces low sulphur diesel fuel, caused market prices to shoot higher in the midcontinent, Gulf Coast and even in New York Harbor last week as traders feared supplies could run short.
The refinery has a total capacity of 188,000 bpd.
-- Matt Daily, New York Energy Desk +1 212 859 1626
